description.narrative:
Africa Caribbean Heritage Alliance (ACHA) is an old grantee of Voice and implemented a brilliant Innovate <(>&<)> Learn grant. Theyhave now been awarded this grant to implement another innovate <(>&<)> learn grant called the 'NOW US AWARD'. This award aims at celebrating inclusion, by bringing together the rights-holders of Voice who have been making efforts/taking little steps towards achieving a responsive <(>&<)> inclusive society. Through this grant, Voice want ACHA to facilitate the selection process for the rights-holders that will be participating in the Now Us Award, prepare them for the award which needs to go through transparent process andfinally mentor and support them in their innovative concepts.
ACHA promises to bring on board, a unique, different and up-scalableapproach that will allow a fresh look at working together to create awareness and platforms for these organizations to work with youth using art, sports, culture, music, dance, artwork and community theatre to transform to speak out, organizethemselves, learn and become advocates and role models. They believe that once youth are educated, they can demonstrate those skills in workshops and the best ones can be awarded, linked to performing artists and crafts experts, twinned with writers, mentored and coached.
Some of the activities ACHA proposes to enable them make this 'NOW US AWARD' successful are: -Conduct outreach and amplify the event to attract right candidates -Organize and facilitate a boot camp to work with the rights-holderson their innovative ideas -Organize the NowUs Award and celebrate rights-holders through the award -Mentor winners that emerge from the award -Facilitate and support the participation of the winners in Inclusion Festival happening in the Hague

participating-org.narrative:
THE VISION: ACHA aims to reunite Africa and the Caribbean in several sectors. The tagline, positively reconnecting the Caribbean with Africa envisages sustainably developing the countries through connecting its peoples.
THE MISSION: ACHA aims to achieve its mission through the positive connections between the continents. The focus therefore is on bringing and building awareness to both Africa about the Caribbean and vice versa and facilitating the opportunities in various sectors as listed and thosethat may arise thereafter.
OBJECTIVES: The objectives of ACHA are:
# To teach African, Caribbean and American histories and cultural similarities and unique differences through related lecture series, hosting and participating in workshops # To organize events and festivals in folklore, music, dance, arts, crafts, cuisine and fashion # To promote tourism and business opportunities through business match makings, organizing joint expositions, trade missions, conferences, seminars and entrepreneurship trainings # To organize exchanges on transnational education, heritage research and sports for development # To promote economic partnerships between Nigeria as a strategic hub to Africa with the Caribbean, Americas, Europe and globally through research, sharing of knowledge and information, and provide access to a wide network of strategic partners # To make recommendations on critical areas for joint projects, develop relevant proposals, seek funding possibilities and provide relevant trainings # To do whatever may be instrumental or useful related to the aforementioned objectives
